1.content:
You arrive at work about 15 minutes early. Few workers have arrived yet but they will come in soon as nine o'clock nears. You are well awake having rolled out of bed at six o'clock am and worked at at the campus gym alongside your wife.

You put your lunch away in the mini-fridge in your office. You turn on your computer to check email for any faculty (instructor) issues that may have arrived in your inbox overnight. You check voice mail for the same.

Are there any faculty issues?
1.title: The day begins

choices: Continue watching the window and ignore the knock
Open the door to someone you don't know
11.content:
As there is nothing to do immediately, you look out of the window before getting stuck into your work. You are opposite a student dorm, and can see into the windows. You have often imagined yourself in the Jimmy Stewart role in Rear Window, with Terry being your Grace Kelly.

Through one window you see a man in a towel wandering around holding an iron. You know, from previous close observation that this flat belongs to a woman, one of your students who you quite like. This could be interesting.

You are woken from your daydreaming by a knock on the door. As you are not usually in work by this time you consider ignoring the knock.
11.title: Looking out the window

choices: Dave takes the package into his office
Dave leaves the package for a co-worker
113.content:
Dave sighed and dragged himself away from his daydreams to answer the door. As he placed his hand on the doorknob, he called out, "I'm sorry, but office hours don't begin for another while. Unless it is an emergency, please come back later." There was a muffled reply from the other side of the door, but Dave couldn't make it out. He stood there a while longer with his hand on the knob, listening. A shuffling sound came from the other side of the door, followed by a sudden thunk, startling Dave. He stepped backward and glanced behind him at the phone. The night security would still be in, but how much help truly is a man with a flashlight when you're in danger? Another sharp rap at the door caused him to jump. "As I said before, business hours haven't started y...."
"Dude!" The surfer term split the air and Dave suddenly felt the overwhelming urge to laugh. "Dude! I'm just hear to drop off a package and they wouldn't take it at the desk downstairs, so they directed me here." Giving into the urge, Dave chuckled as he made his way to the door and opened it to a skinny young man dressed in a brown shirt and shorts. In front of him lay a large package. Dave laughed once more.
"Sorry 'bout that. I'm not usually at work at this time, so...." With a disgruntled look, the young man shoved a clipboard and pen into Dave's hands.
"It's cool, man. Just sign, I gotta get back to work myself." Dave did as he was told and returned to clipboard; and with a wave, the delivery boy disappeared off down the hall, leaving Dave to ponder the large package he had left behind.
113.title: Who could it be now?

1131.content:
Dave places the large package in the corner of his office opposite his desk. It is an unusually heavy package and warm to touch. Dave notices the package is addressed for Jack. The package is odd, even for Jack. Dave is accustomed to the odd packages that enter and exit his college. This being the College of Technology he is used to extremely strange deliveries, but this one gives Dave pause and he stares at the package for a few moments drawn into a hazy daydream state before snapping back to reality and returning to his chair to face the computer screen.

Dave scrolls though his email looking for any work requests he may have missed or newsletter subscriptions that might catch his interest, anything to break up the boredom and monotony the next eight and half hours will bring. Just as Dave opens a newsletter he hears voices.

"Must be after 9:00 am. People are showing up, " Dave mutters to himself as he glances at the clock. The clock reads 8:50 am. The voices stop. Dave gets up, opens his door to look down the hallways, and sees no one. Just as he turns to enter his office he hears the voices again. Dave wheels around to scan the hallways once more. No one. "The ghosts of angry students I guess, " Dave says as he closes to door and returns to his desk.

A shivering chill shakes Dave's nerves as he sits in his chair. He quickly looks at the odd package in the corner. He feels a warmth radiating from the package and the voices return. As Dave stares at the package. His vision of the package blurs. He looks at the picture on the wall above the package to test his vision. The picture is perfectly clear, but as he glances down the package remains blurry. The voices are louder now, Dave can hear them a little more clearly now, but cannot make out the words to the pleasing and melodic sound. The voices are singing and chanting repeating the same sequence.

Dave has lost himself in staring at this odd package. He is aware how chillingly cold his body feels and the feeling of warmth radiating from the package falling over his face as he stares at the package. He is drawn to the package, and he is afraid of it at the same time. He ...
1131.title: Dave takes the package into his office

11311.content:
As Dave got closer to the package, he quickly felt dizzy and the urge to strip as it was now quickly getting so hot that ypu can literally cook in the room.He also heard the whisper "Come closer" getting louder and louder.

When he touched the box, the entire room plunged into coldness. Even the thermometer he hanged on the wall broke and he
11311.title: What's is happening?

choices: Put it aside and explore it after he was free.
113111.content:
Even though he felt guilty of opening Jack's package, he opened the package. Insife he found a rectangular-shaped device that actually speaks.

Also you found the manual of this device but it is written in a language that you don't understand. You think that you will have to explore the device before even touching anything but as he watch the clock it was already 9 past 5. You decided to
113111.title: What's in the package?

choices: Skip lunch with Terry and continue to explore the device.
Have lunch with Terry and bring the device into your car for safe keeping.
1131112.content:
He hid the device under his desk. Just as it is hidden, Jeff came in with another box of materials. You only found out that that box was for his projects and he thank Jeff. Jeff left and he started doing his work.

It is almost lunch break and he decided to explore the device. He took it out and started to see what buttons it had. He suddenly remembered that he he was supposed to have lunch with his wife,Terry. He decided to
1131112.title: What to do?

choices: waited paciently for a figure to appear.
11313.content: Dave stands up and walks toward the exit of his office but as he does an illusion takes over and stretches out the walls of the office, making it appear as though he will never make it to the door. He glances down at the package that lay before him. He still hadn't past it. He was just about to sprint toward the door when an icy cold hand grabbed his ankle from behind him. "Wait." A child like voice replied. The voice seemed to echo. Dave...
11313.title: leaves his office

13.content:
Sherry has left a frantic message on your voicemail. She doesn't know how to check student progress in her class website. Students are emailing her claiming that her lecture materials cannot be found.

You realize that the instructor has made a mistake. You log onto the instructor's webstie and fix the problem and email the instructor to inform her you have made the correction.
13.title: Disaster averted.

131.content:
It is nearly 10 am. Most of your coworkers should have arrived by now. However, things run loosly at an institution of higher learning.

You have some reports that need to be taken upstairs to main office sometime today. Chances are that Jack is not at work yet, and that Meg and Edith are. You will have to run in the reports to Meg or Edith. Both will require that you have a lasting social/work convesation with both seperately since they do not get along.

You can visit Jeff's office to discuss some plans you have for your program that Jeff may want to put in place as well. You can go alone without his input but if he follows your vision you will have an easier time getting your plans moving forward. A visit to Jeff's office will result in a long conversation that will drift in and out of social and professional topics.
131.title: Nonadventure

choices: Instigate the unavoidable conversation with Edith.
Take the wide-open door fate has provided.
1311.content:
You look at your watch again and consider sitting back and relaxing at your desk. Either way will be wasted time, you fear. But getting morning respects out of the way would be more beneficial and progressive, yet slow. Out the door and down the hallway you go, reports in hand. Your footsteps echo in the emptiness and silence of your surroundings. Wouldn't be too much longer before the normal morning bustle. It only took half a minute to navigate the staircase, despite taking it rather slow. Upon entering the first office on the right: "Good morning, Edith. First one here today?" You could tell she had just started settling in for the day due to the neatness of her desk.

"Why no, Davy. Jack is in his office. Arrived here a few minutes before me, I do believe," was her perky reply; always perky and full of energy unless Meg was around. That's when it became all hush, hush library voices in the main office. You seemed to have picked the prime moment. Edith seemed distracted with the large load of papers she just plopped on her desk from the IN box, Meg was running a little late, and Jack was in. The door of golden opportunity was open as far as it could go, but just as like all things in life, there were choices to be made.
1311.title: Work Day Beginning

info.brief_description: Make the choices a man is presented during his everyday life.
info.description:
You are a man who goes to work and begins making daily choices. How do the daily choices we make affect our everyday life? How can a seemingly simple and small decision change the course of our life?

Your name is Dave you are known as Davy. You are 32 years old with a young wife and a pet puppy. You work at a university as a program manager in a technology program. You are very intelligent, attractive, MBA, caring.

Terry is your wife. 25 year old medical student.

Jack is your boss. You like him and trust him a great deal. He is very loyal to you and his department and he has no patience for office politics. Mid to late 40s, white, intelligent Ph D, married, 2 20-something kids. He trusts and likes you.

Meg is the office coordinator (the pc title for office secretary). Early 50s, small, asian, hard working, emotional, friendly, trusting, no married, no kids. She trusts and likes you.

Edith is the assistance office coordinator. Somewhat troubled, overweight, lonely, insecure, friendly, 25. She trusts and likes you.

Jeff is your counterpart for another program. Late 40s, friendly, talkative, incompetent, married. He likes you.

Darren is an overeducated underwhelming sort of fellow who is jealous of many former counterparts who have recently been promoted around him. Somewhat moody, overweight, intellignet, lazy, 32, engaged. He likes you.
